channel.title: [PI] easy question
channel.description:
Hello, how can I make certain items not spawnable?
Thanks in advanced,
Tyler

item.title: [PI] easy question
item.dc:creator: @xtylerr xtylerr
item.description:
@xtylerr wrote:

I know how to make certain people spawn, I mean certain items.

It’s a pk server, but I want people to be able to spawn chaotic weapons, dragon claws, ags, ect. Those are earned by pk points.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] easy question
item.dc:creator: @metal_k0 metal k0
item.description:
@metal_k0 wrote:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:106: cannot find symbol symbol : variable cantSpawn location: class server.model.players.Client if (newItemID != c.cantS pawn) { ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error

Here’s what I added in config.java. (it wasn’t in there yet)

        public static final int[] cantSpawn       =        {15027,15028,15007,15006,15005,15004}; // Items you cannot spawn.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] easy question
item.dc:creator: @frostyboy07 frostyboy07
item.description:
@frostyboy07 wrote:

metal k0:

The public static int cantSpawn isn’t in there? U.U

My bad, it is in config.Java o.O

If it isn’t, then add it in:

	public static int[] cantSpawn	=	{itemid,itemid,itemid};

But it should be in there.

item.title: [PI] easy question
item.dc:creator: @metal_k0 metal k0
item.description:
@metal_k0 wrote:

[quote=“frostyboy07, post:2, topic:376889”]OK.

Go to player.Java and search for this:

public static int cantSpawn[]

Now, add and/or edit the item ids you don’t want people spawning.

public static int cantSpawn[] = {itemid, itemid, itemid};

Now, in commands.Java, replace your ::item command with this one:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) {
				try {
					String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3) {
						int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
						int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
						if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
							if (newItemID != c.cantSpawn) {
								c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);	
							} else {
								c.sendMessage("You cant spawn this item.");
                                                        }
						} else {
							c.sendMessage("No such item.");
						}
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("Use as ::item 995 200");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
				}
			}

Add player rights to it yourself, as I don’t know who you want to be able to spawn, and who you don’t want to.

This should work, hope I helped! :)[/quote]

The public static int cantSpawn isn’t in there? U.U

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] easy question
item.dc:creator: @frostyboy07 frostyboy07
item.description:
@frostyboy07 wrote:

OK.

Go to config.Java and search for this:

public static int cantSpawn[]

Now, add and/or edit the item ids you don’t want people spawning.

public static int cantSpawn[] = {itemid, itemid, itemid};

Now, in commands.Java, replace your ::item command with this one:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) {
				try {
					String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3) {
						int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
						int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
						if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
							if (newItemID != c.cantSpawn) {
								c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);	
							} else {
								c.sendMessage("You cant spawn this item.");
                                                        }
						} else {
							c.sendMessage("No such item.");
						}
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("Use as ::item 995 200");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
				}
			}

Add player rights to it yourself, as I don’t know who you want to be able to spawn, and who you don’t want to.

This should work, hope I helped!
